resources.string: The transit of Venus allowed scientists to calculate the size of our solar system as early as 1761–1769
The atmospheric pressure on Mars is lower than on Earth, causing humans to boil if exposed directly to the atmosphere
In the Pythagoras’s model the Earth was placed in the middle of the Universe, where the stars, Moon and planets were attached to celestial spheres orbiting the Earth
Helium was named after the greek word helios, meaning sun, after being discovered by observing the sun
Eratosthenes calculated the circumference of the Earth in 500 BC by using geometry and shadows cast in the two cities Alexandria and Syene
Close up of Saturn by NASA
